snippet: Friday’s weak employment report was a potential turning point, focusing new attention on the economic implications of the partisan standoff over tax and spending policy.
abstract: Weak employment report has the potential to reshape the presidential campaign, lifting Mitt Romney’s efforts to focus the race on Pres Obama’s handling of the economy and making it harder for Democrats to define Romney on their terms; signs of a slowdown place new attention on the implications of the Congressional standoff over tax and spending policy.

byline.original: By JONATHAN WEISMAN and MARK LANDLER
byline.contributor: Jonathan Weisman reported from Washington and Mark Landler from Golden Valley, Minn. Michael D. Shear contributed reporting from Washington.

lead_paragraph: Friday’s weak employment report was a potential turning point, focusing new attention on the economic implications of the partisan standoff over tax and spending policy.

headline.seo: Weak Job Growth Could Alter Presidential Campaign
headline.main: Slowdown in Growth Could Reshape Fight for Presidency
headline.print_headline: Sag in Economy Could Reshape ’12 Campaigns
